At 10:41 PM 1/25/01 , Jakob Jenkov wrote: 
>
> The biggest challenge about testing thread safety must be to simulate that
> one thread is preempted a a certain vulnerable point, while another thread is
> accessing shared resources.


I've toyed with the idea of writing a "VM from hell" that would provide only
the bare minimum synchronization guarantees from the Java Language Spec.  If
someone has a Java VM written in Java, that would be a good starting point. 
You could rewrite the thread scheduler to make scheduling as pessimal as
possible.

John Brewer
Jera Design
